resources.description: The Agenda 21 for culture is the reference document of the local governments to draw up their cultural policies. It’s based on the principles of cultural diversity, human rights, intercultural dialogue, participatory democracy, sustainability and peace.
resources.name: Agenda 21 for culture (text in English)

resources.description: List of cities, local governments and organizations, which joined the Agenda 21 for culture and have the obligations (1 February 2012).
resources.name: List of members of the Agenda 21 for culture (1 February 2012)

organization.description: This is a group to collect and curate high value and high quality datasets related to international development and aid.
organization.title: International Development Data
organization.name: international-development

name: volunteers-wikimedia-foundation
notes:
Please learn more about our main aim (one of several here), clicking this link for the good of Knowlege world wide. The Wikimedia Foundation, Inc. is a nonprofit charitable organization dedicated to encouraging the growth, development and distribution of free, multilingual content, and to providing the full content of these wiki-based projects to the public free of charge. The Wikimedia Foundation operates some of the largest collaboratively edited reference projects in the world, including Wikipedia, a top-ten internet property. Currently in the world big meaning in the scope of education and culture has the Agenda 21 for culture (official website and about). On May 8th 2004, United Cities and Local Governments (UCLG) adopted the Agenda 21 for culture as a reference document for its programmes on culture and assumed the role of coordinator of the process subsequent to its approval (about UCLG). Representatives of the Agenda 21 for culture from the United States: 1) National League of Cities (read about); 2) Corpus Christi, Texas (read about); This page created to support as the projects of Wikimedia Foundation, so and for the good of interests of simple people, when their human rights were violated. Such aim is the common aim of our mission. Please write requests and we will make conclusions to do them accessible to the general public. Like the Human Rights Watch (at Wikipedia). We ready to learn your trouble with the big attention. Later we will publish our professional opinion here (with the results), to reach the public response. Our team is the team of the experts in a large number of scopes. Organization Wikimedia Foundation and its the volunteers works to support all people in the world independently of something. Knowlege and fairness are related things.
BLACK LIST SEE BELOW
We got 27 may 2 requests on the violation of human rights (the result is ready): Vandalism currently is implemented in RU Wikipedia by users OneLittleMouse and Alex Smotrov (and illegal blockings). We suggest for the attention of general public all exploits of these people to be free from suspicion of bias. Punishment in such cases, is the shame in the eyes of the society and the blocking (when violation is more of middle). And these people will always under attention of the wide public. Links to the them exploits are the permanent here (and saved in cache also).
title: Volunteers of Wikimedia Foundation
